sense.name: a unit measure of one
sense.examples: Mary ordered a double espresso and John ordered a single. Do you have any singles in your pocket to pay the bellboy? (single dollar bills) A single in this hotel will cost $200 a night, and a double will cost $275. (single room)

sense.name: unmarried or romantically unattached person
sense.examples: The bar is mostly frequented by singles and 20-somethings. Bob is the only single Mary knows among her male friends.

sense.name: short musical recording with one song
sense.examples: The old vinyl 78 singles had one song on each side. You can download MP3 singles from your favorite rock groups from this website.

sense.name: baseball play where player makes one base safely
sense.examples: Jones struck out in the first, hit a single in the fourth, and hit a home run in the ninth. The hit should have only been a single except for an outfield error.

sense.name: sports competition played between individuals, not teams
sense.examples: He is one of the top players in the world today, in men's singles. She played badminton singles in college.
